message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Quick Assets.  
Quick Assets include Cash on Hand, Bank Deposits, Interest Receivable, and Accounts Receivable. From the balance sheet at 2024-02-01, we have:  
 • Cash on Hand = 376,598.62  
 • Bank Deposits = 100,482.62  
 • Interest Receivable = 5,155.34  
 • Accounts Receivable = 3,098,023.69  

Adding these together:  
 Quick Assets = 376,598.62 + 100,482.62 + 5,155.34 + 3,098,023.69  
         = 3,580,260.27  

Step 2. Identify the Total Current Liabilities.  
From the balance sheet, the Total Current Liabilities at 2024-02-01 is:  
 Total Current Liabilities = 1,601,835.08  

Step 3. Compute the Quick Ratio.  
Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Total Current Liabilities  
      = 3,580,260.27 / 1,601,835.08 ≈ 2.23  

Step 4. Calculate the Net Profit Margin.  
Net Profit Margin is given by (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%.  
From the income statement at 2024-02-01:  
 • Net Profit = -2,035,736.52  
 • Total Revenue = 6,836,701.10  

Thus,  
 Net Profit Margin = (-2,035,736.52 / 6,836,701.10) × 100  
            ≈ -29.78%  

Final Answer in JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "2.23",
    "Net Profit Margin": "-29.78%"
  }
}
